action: I want to process applications such as expenses and purchases through a rule-based approval flow
reason: Because I need to prevent fraudulent applications and approval omissions to maintain internal control
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users to create applications.
The system must require a mandatory Application Type (e.g., Expense, Purchase, Leave) for every submission.
The system shall maintain specific approval workflow definitions for each application type, editable only by Administrators.
The system must support configurable multi-stage approval steps associated with specific roles.
The system shall automatically determine approvers based on roles and route to proxy approvers if the primary approver is absent.
The system must validate mandatory fields and ensure amount fields contain strictly numeric values upon saving.
The system shall execute a virus scan on all attachments and store them in an encrypted storage container.
The system must automatically generate a globally unique Application ID for each record.
The system shall strictly enforce status transitions restricted to 'Draft', 'Pending', 'Approved', and 'Rejected'.
The system must prevent applications from advancing to the next step without the required approval.
The system shall restrict approval operations exclusively to users with the appropriate authority.
The system must record an electronic signature log for every approval action.
The system shall allow optional comments for approvals but must require a mandatory reason for rejections.
The system must generate immutable audit logs for every approval or rejection, capturing User ID, Action, Timestamp, and IP.
The system shall restrict application editing to the 'Draft' state and prohibit modification once the status is 'Pending'.
The system must maintain a history of any changes to the workflow definition or application content.
The system shall implement optimistic locking to detect and prevent concurrent update conflicts.
The system must use parameterized queries and input sanitization to prevent SQL injection and XSS attacks.
The system shall enforce CSRF protection and require HTTPS (TLS 1.2+) for all communications.
The system must publish a notification event to an asynchronous queue upon workflow completion.
The system shall support searching and filtering of application history by type, date, and status.
The system must monitor approval latency and trigger alert notifications if Service Level Agreement (SLA) thresholds are exceeded.
The system shall provide a RESTful API with version control and must not expose internal database structures in responses.
The system must store audit logs in tamper-evident storage with configurable retention periods.
The system shall target an API response time of under 500ms for workflow operations.
